Description: Open the Control Panel "Install a program from the network" applet
Equivalent: Control Panel > Get Programs from the network

Description: Open the user‘s Start Menu\Administrative Tools folder (if any)
Open the user‘s Application Data folder

Equivalent: Control Panel > Programs and Features> Installed updates

Description: Open the folder where files are stored before being burned to disc
Open the Client Side Cache Offline Files folder, if supported
Open the Temporary Internet Files folder
Open the Control Panel "Uninstall or change a program" applet
Equivalent: Control Panel > Uninstall or change a program

Description: Open All Users Start Menu\Administrative Tools folder
Open the Public Application Data folder
Open the Public Start Menu Programs folder
Open the Public Start Menu folder
Open the list of Network Connections
Open the user‘s Windows Contacts folder
Open the Internet Explorer Cookies folder
Open the user‘s encryption keys folder
Open the default Sidebar Gadgets folder
Open the Internet Explorer Favorites folder
Open the user folder of downloaded Sidebar Gadgets
Open the user‘s Game Explorer folder
Open the HomeGroup folder for the currently logged-on user (if any)
Launches Internet Explorer Applets and applications
Open the user‘s Application Data folder
Open the user‘s Network Places folder
Display links provided by your PC manufacturer (if any)
Open the Windows Photo Gallery Original Images folder, if installed
Open the user‘s Pictures\Slide Shows folder (if present)
Open the user‘s printer shortcuts folder
Open the Program Files\Common Files folder
Open the Common Files for 32-bit programs stored on 64-bit Windows,
Or the Program Files\Common Files folder on 32-bit Windows
or the \Program Files folder on 32-bit Windows
Open the user‘s Start Menu Programs folder
Open the Public Game Explorer folder
Open the Public user tiles folder
Open the Quick Launch folder (disabled by default)
Open the user‘s Recent Documents folder
Open the Windows Resources folder (themes are stored here)
Open the user‘s Send To folder
Open the user‘s Start Menu folder
Open the Sync Centre Setup options
Equivalent: Control Panel > Setup new Sync Partnerships

Description: Open the Windows System folder for 32-bit files on 64-bit Windows,
Access shortcuts pinned to the Start menu or Taskbar
Equivalent: %AppData%\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Quick Launch\User Pinned\= C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Quick Launch\User Pinned

Description: Open the folder holding all user profiles
Display your user tiles (the images you can use for your account)
